Recent News

Grant money has been spent! 11 Dec 2016

Tanya McLachlan-Troup and Mark Pearson have kindly donated their time to go and spend our $3000 grant money, awarded by The Mens Shed Association.

We applied for this grant around a year ago and it was granted a few months ago. We have finally got around to spending the money, and we are celebrating by having a BBQ next Wednesday (14 Dec 2016). We want you to join us to celebrate the purchasing of the new tools with the grant money!

Vegan sausages and gluten-free bread will be available.

Sausages are $1 and cans are $1.

So please come along to help celebrate and check out the tools!

-- Craig Marshall

A lathe for Hobart hackerspace 02 Nov 2016

We have been very fortunate with donations to Hobart hackerspace. Recently, we had a donation of a sherline 3‚Äù precision lathe. ( thanks, Ray! )

This machine was covered in the dust of ages, but the parts are all in very good condition. So, being hackers, the first thing we did was to pull our new machine apart. A bit of a polish on the brass, and a bit of oil in the moving parts, and away it went.

This lathe is quite small and simple to use, but remember - it is a power tool. Remember to wear safety glasses. Think about what you are doing. If in doubt, ask!

-- fairly.sirius

Mon/Wed internet access 03 Aug 2016

Most mondays and wednesdays someone plugs something either misconfigured or malicious into the network which breaks it. please check your devices.

-- jjbarrows

Live Blog 27 Apr 2016

Hi and welcome to my first live update from a Weekly Meeting.

There is a bit of tinkering going on tonight as well as some visitors being shown around the place.

Brian is working on ‚ÄúRepairing‚Äù an old british electric beater. Looks interesting and will be great to see it working at another meeting. Maybe he can mix us some nice batter to make some donuts.

One of the Mark‚Äôs is working on a homebuilt Infrared thermometer using and Arduino Nano with a infrared temprature sensor (Freetronics) and a nice OLED display from a kickstarter (See, some things do actually eventuate from Kickstarter).

BREAKING NEWS - As I am typing this the space‚Äôs new 3D Printer has just turned up. Looks like a Sunday Session coming up. The new printer is a Duinotech TL-4100 Delta Kit. Stay tuned for more updates on this.

We are also looking at one of the new mini CNC‚Äôs. A very nice looking device which will set you back about $650 from Ebay. More details will follow in a post later this week.

David is busy engraving a logo onto a chopping board for a prize. At least we have some use coming to the Laser Cutter. We are currently looking into upgrading the laser tube on this so it should be more usefull soon.

We also have some general tidying up going on around the place.

It is good to see a buzz of activity going on at the moment. So heading into the cooler months the Hackspace seems to be picking up again which is good to see.

So tell your friends and get them coming along to join in the journey, plus no doubt get into some interesting conversations about what we are going to try and computerised next (yes we will eventually finish the knitting machine).

So see you next week with the next live blog and hopefully some other updates through the week.

-- alkaline
